metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9376 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.1 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.7, the OpenFlow dissectorcould crash with memory exhaustion, triggered by network traffic or acapture file. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-openflow_v5.c byensuring that certain length values were sufficiently large.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwireshark8 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwiretap6 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwscodecs1 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwsutil7 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
tshark - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-common - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-gtk - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-qt - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04').
